hu.unideb.kgsoft.scrabble

Interface GameView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameWindowController

    public interface GameView
    An interface defining common services a view class for the game should provide. The abstract methods defined here will be called by the controller class to update the view.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawBoard()
      Draws the game board on a graphics surface.
      void drawTileInHand(int tileCode, double mouseX, double mouseY) 
      void drawTileOnBoard(int tileCode, int row, int col)
      Draws an image of the tile, which is located on the board at the given row and column indices with the given tile code.
      void drawTileOnTray(int tileCode, int index) 
      double getHeight()
      Returns the height of the graphics surface on which the tiles and the game board can be drawn.
      double getWidth()
      Returns the width of the graphics surface on which the tiles and the game board can be drawn.
      void updateGameStateInfo(GameState gameState)
      The view class updates the informations about the state of the game on the screen.

    • Method Detail

      • drawTileOnBoard

        void drawTileOnBoard(int tileCode,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Draws an image of the tile, which is located on the board at the given row and column indices with the given tile code. Calculates the x and y coordinates corresponding to the row and column indices on the board, to draw the image on the graphics surface.
        Parameters:
        tileCode - the unique code of the tile, that has to be drawn
        row - the row index of the tile on the board
        col - the column index of the tile on the board

      • drawTileOnTray

        void drawTileOnTray(int tileCode,
                    int index)

      • drawTileInHand

        void drawTileInHand(int tileCode,
                    double mouseX,
                    double mouseY)

      • drawBoard

        void drawBoard()
        Draws the game board on a graphics surface. It serves as a background for drawing the letter tiles. It is expected from the implementing class, that the graphical representation of the tiles on the game board will reflect their actual position.

      • getWidth

        double getWidth()
        Returns the width of the graphics surface on which the tiles and the game board can be drawn.
        Returns:
        the width of the graphics surface

      • getHeight

        double getHeight()
        Returns the height of the graphics surface on which the tiles and the game board can be drawn.
        Returns:
        the height of the graphics surface

      • updateGameStateInfo

        void updateGameStateInfo(GameState gameState)
        The view class updates the informations about the state of the game on the screen. Uses the values from the provided GameState object as parameter.
        Parameters:
        gameState - the GameState object
